data.title: Against the Grain: More Meat Than Wheat (1981)
data.meta_description: Drama - An Anzac Day stunt intended as a political statement is viewed as an act of terrorism, forcing Ray Unit further underground, fleeing to his childhood home on the other side of Australia. - Michael Callaghan, Sandy Edwards, Joy Burns
data.text:
Got weirdly attached to the protag, the movie was strangely funny at times, extremely disturbing at others. Politically didnt hash over anything I didn’t already know.

I could build a better bomb.

(Ok I’m cheating with this rating, giving them an extra half star for the small budget charm)

Australia your god is apathy

I think often about how even as a kid the majority of my media diet came from overseas, primarily US and UK exports. That in of itself is Australian culture, a nation second to it's colonial cousins. Engaging with media made or about here is not a default, this year I'd like to make an effort to. Political apathy is default here, default in a way that i believe is somewhat unique. What overtly political conversation does occur is often borrowed from or about American political theater. In contrast our electoral politics are quiet and comfortable in the hands of liberal democracy.

Against the Grain was oh so perfect of a pick to start this…
